com.vaadin.ui.videojs

Class VideojsPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractJavaScriptComponent
      • com.vaadin.ui.videojs.VideojsPlayer

  • public class VideojsPlayer
extends AbstractJavaScriptComponent
    VideojsPlayer belongs to the VaadiProject created 2013.

    VideoPlayer makes it possible to play various types of video sources in a single widget.

    Since:
    11.10.2013
    Version:
    v0.1
    Author:
    Juha Mäkilä, Sami Holck

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  VideojsPlayer.VideojsListener
      An Interface which listens to a Video.js event

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String MP4_MIME
      MIME type for *.mp4 video sources (MPEG 4 files with H264 video codec and AAC audio codec)
      static String OGG_MIME
      MIME type for *.ogg video sources (Ogg files with Theora video codec and Vorbis audio codec)
      static String VIMEO_MIME
      MIME type for Vimeo video sources "https://vimeo.com/"
      static String WEBM_MIME
      MIME type for *.webm video sources (WebM files with VP8 video codec and Vorbis audio codec)
      static String YOUTUBE_MIME
      MIME type for Youtube video sources "https://www.youtube.com/"

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideojsPlayer

        public VideojsPlayer()

      • VideojsPlayer

        public VideojsPlayer(String videoSrc,
             String mimeType)

        Supported MIME types for video:

        • video/ogg
        • video/mp4
        • video/webm
        Parameters:
        videoSrc - the source path of the video file.
        mimeType - the MIME type of the video.

    • Method Detail

      • addVideojsListener

        public void addVideojsListener(String eventName,
                      VideojsPlayer.VideojsListener listener)
        Adds a new Video.js event listener to the player.
        Parameters:
        eventName - The Video.js event the listener will listen to.
        listener - The event listener object itself.

      • removeVideojsListener

        public void removeVideojsListener(String eventName,
                         VideojsPlayer.VideojsListener eventListener)
        Remove Video.js listener from specific Video.js event.
        Parameters:
        eventName - Event to remove listener from.
        eventListener - Video.js Listener to remove.

      • removeVideojsListener

        public void removeVideojsListener(VideojsPlayer.VideojsListener eventListener)
        Remove listener from all Video.js events it is registered by. Convenient way of cleaning up a Video.js listener object being destroyed.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - Video.js Event listener to remove.

      • setSource

        public void setSource(String videoSrc,
             String mimeType)
        Sets the video source and the video type

        Supported MIME types for the VideojsPlayer:

        • video/ogg
        • video/mp4
        • video/webm
        Parameters:
        videoSrc - the source path of the video file
        mimeType - the MIME type of the video

        public String getVideoSrc()
        Returns the source of the video stream.
        Returns:
        the source of the video stream.

        public String getMimeType()
        Returns the MIME Type of the video stream.
        Returns:

        public double getCurrentTime()
        Returns the current time of the video in seconds.
        Returns:

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays the video.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the video

      • seekTo

        public void seekTo(double time)
        Seeks to the supplied time in video (seconds).
        Parameters:
        time - The new sought time of the video in seconds.

      • pauseAt

        public void pauseAt(double time)
        Pauses the video play back on the given time.

        NOTE: this method replaces all previously defined pause times.

        Parameters:
        time - Pausing time.

      • pauseAt

        public void pauseAt(Collection<Double> times)
        Pauses the video play back on the given times.

        NOTE: this method replaces all previously defined pause times.

        Parameters:
        times - Pausing times.

      • setPlayerDimensions

        public void setPlayerDimensions(int width,
                       int height)
        Changes the width and height of the Video.js player to the supplied width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - The width in pixels
        height - The height in pixels

      • setMasked

        public void setMasked(boolean masked)
        Deprecated. Do not use this method.
        Sets a mask element over the Video.js player.
        Parameters:
        masked - mask elements visibility flag.

      • mask

        public void mask(String label,
        int delay)
        Displays a mask over the Video.js player element.
        Parameters:
        label - Text message that will be displayed on top of the mask besides an info icon.
        delay - Delay in milliseconds before player element is masked. If unmask() is called before the delay times out, no mask is displayed. This can be used to prevent unnecessary mask display for quick processes.

      • mask

        public void mask(String label)
        Displays a mask over the Video.js player element.
        Parameters:
        label - text message that will be displayed on top of the mask besides an info icon.

      • mask

        public void mask()
        Displays a mask over the Video.js player element. Only the mask will be displayed without a label

      • unmask

        public void unmask()
        Removes the mask from the Video.js player element.

      • isMasked

        public boolean isMasked()
        Checks if the Video.js element is masked.
        Returns:
        false if mask is delayed or not displayed, true otherwise.

      • seekingEnabled

        public void seekingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables / disables the video stream position seeking possibility from the user.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true enables the seeking, false disables.
